title: Secret Speakeasy Adventure #28
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Dark Back Alley
rooms.description: A dimly lit alley behind a seemingly abandoned warehouse in downtown Chicago. The year is 1925, and Prohibition is in full swing. Trash cans line the brick walls, and a single flickering streetlamp casts long shadows. You can hear distant jazz music and smell cigar smoke. A heavy metal door is set into the wall, and a fire escape ladder hangs overhead.

items.name: dented trash can
items.description: A metal trash can overflowing with newspapers and refuse

items.name: Chicago Tribune clipping
items.description: A torn newspaper article from 1925
items.text: PROHIBITION CONTINUES: Five years since the Volstead Act of 1920 banned alcohol. Federal agents raid suspected speakeasies daily. Rumor has it the Cotton Club's owner, Big Eddie Malone, operates the finest underground establishment in the city.

items.name: wooden shipping crate
items.description: A crate marked 'FRAGILE - GLASSWARE' with loose boards

items.name: iron crowbar
items.description: A heavy crowbar, perfect for prying open locked doors

items.name: rusty fire escape ladder
items.description: A ladder leading up to a boarded window

items.name: bootlegger's note
items.description: A crumpled note hidden behind the ladder
items.text: Reminder: The cellar lock combination is the year Prohibition started, followed by the year it's supposed to end (1933). Don't forget! - Sal

items.name: heavy metal door
items.description: A reinforced door with a sturdy lock. The wood around the lock looks weak enough to pry open.

rooms.name: Underground Storage Cellar
rooms.description: A brick-walled cellar filled with wooden barrels and crates. The air is cool and smells of aged whiskey. Dim electric bulbs hang from the ceiling. Against one wall stands a locked cabinet, and a large barrel has been converted into a makeshift desk. You can hear muffled jazz music and laughter coming from behind a concealed door in the far wall.

items.name: barrel desk
items.description: A large barrel with a wooden plank on top serving as a desk surface

items.name: bootlegger's ledger
items.description: A leather-bound book with records of illegal alcohol shipments
items.text: Shipment Log: Canadian whiskey arrives every Tuesday. Big Eddie Malone runs this operation. The password to enter the club changes weekly - this week it's the name of the famous Cotton Club in Harlem. Remember: Eddie, Cotton Club, Harlem.

items.name: wooden liquor cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with three compartments, secured with various locks

items.name: concert poster
items.description: A colorful poster advertising a jazz performance
items.text: LIVE JAZZ TONIGHT! Featuring Louis Armstrong at the Cotton Club, Harlem's finest speakeasy. Doors open at 9 PM. Password required for entry.

items.name: small brass key
items.description: A key with a tag reading 'Storage Room 3'

items.name: locked storage crate
items.description: A reinforced crate with a brass padlock

items.name: speakeasy membership card
items.description: A card with embossed lettering
items.text: MEMBER: The Cotton Club - Chicago Branch. Proprietor: Big Eddie Malone. Present this card and answer the doorman's questions to gain entry. Location: Harlem district.

items.name: dusty wine rack
items.description: A rack holding empty bottles and one sealed envelope

items.name: sealed envelope
items.description: An envelope marked 'CONFIDENTIAL'
items.text: To all staff: The speakeasy entrance requires three answers: Who runs this establishment? What's the name of our club? Where is the original Cotton Club located? Stay sharp and keep the feds out. - Eddie

items.name: concealed speakeasy door
items.description: A hidden door disguised as a bookshelf. A small speaking slot opens when you approach, and a gruff voice asks for verification.

password_questions.question: Who runs this establishment?
password_questions.hint: Check the ledger book and membership card

password_questions.question: What's the name of our club?
password_questions.hint: The jazz poster and membership card mention this

password_questions.question: Where is the original Cotton Club located?
password_questions.hint: Read the concert poster and membership card carefully

rooms.name: The Cotton Club Speakeasy
rooms.description: You've made it! The speakeasy is alive with energy. A jazz band plays on a small stage, couples dance on a crowded floor, and well-dressed patrons sip cocktails at the bar. Crystal chandeliers cast a warm glow over velvet booths. The bartender slides a glass of champagne across the mahogany bar to you with a knowing wink. Behind the bar, a door marked 'EXIT' leads to freedom.

items.name: live jazz band
items.description: A talented quartet playing hot jazz on trumpet, piano, drums, and saxophone

items.name: polished mahogany bar
items.description: A beautiful bar stocked with illegal liquor from around the world

items.name: glass of champagne
items.description: A crystal flute filled with bubbling French champagne

items.name: velvet booth
items.description: Luxurious seating where Chicago's elite gather to drink and socialize

rooms.win_message: Success! You've gained entry to the most exclusive speakeasy in Chicago. Big Eddie Malone himself raises a glass to you from across the room. The jazz is hot, the drinks are cold, and you're now part of the secret world of Prohibition-era nightlife. The exit is yours whenever you're ready, but for now, enjoy the party! You win!
